title.narrative: Mechanism 17570 - GHSC-PSM

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
As articulated in the Governance and Systems TAN, Cambodia has persistent issues related to procurement and supply-chain management for health commodities, including anti-retrovirals and other HIV-related commodities. This is a broad, systemic issue within the health sector and has lacked any significant interventions in the past. The national HIV program, implemented by NCHADS, has managed to m Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

As articulated in the Governance and Systems TAN, Cambodia has persistent issues related to procurement and supply-chain management for health commodities, including anti-retrovirals and other HIV-related commodities. This is a broad, systemic issue within the health sector and has lacked any significant interventions in the past. The national HIV program, implemented by NCHADS, has managed to maintain sufficient stocks of ARVs to avoid complete stock-outs, but patients report often having to return to clinics monthly due to stock shortages. There have also been stock-outs and stock shortages of other HIV commodities, including rapid-test kits. Additionally, efforts to provide combined HIV and family-planning services have been threatened by stock-outs of condoms at OI/ART sites.
Over the past year, the PEPFAR team has worked with the Global Fund and other partners to raise the awareness around the supply chain concerns. With COP 2014 resources, PEPFAR will provide support for the follow-on mechanism to the DELIVER project to engage in this issue. These funds will continue work that is being started with the Global Fund CCI funding. Work will include improving and strengthening the drug forecasting, ordering, tracking, and distribution system and reducing bottlenecks in the drug and health commodities delivery systems in Cambodia. The work will be undertaken from a health system strengthening perspective, looking to rectify the issue of parallel supply chain systems that have been set up for HIV and malaria.
PEPFAR will explore leveraging Global Fund support to establish a web-based logistics and supply chain management system linked to the MOH web-based Health Information System.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 1800 G Street, N.W., Suite 10300, Washington, DC 20006

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

title.narrative: This area of the State Department website contains the standard terms and conditions documents incorporated by reference into all standard grants, cooperative agreements, fixed amount awards, award to individuals, and property awards to U.S. and foreign recipients that are not Foreign Public Entities.
